result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean D Kuehl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full.  See assessment report.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol or detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations, including establishment of a driver safety plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
D.A. John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Thomas Johnson.
Per motion hearing held on 11-17-14, this is a 4th offense, misd.  Atty. Johnson will prepare an order to reflect same.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed today.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to the amended charge, per 346.65 (2) (dm).
BAC - .169
Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant found guilty on the amended charge. 
The Court orders that sentence be withheld and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. 
Conditions:  1)  Pay a fine of $1000.00 plus costs, total $2240.00, and any other applicable costs or fees.  Cash bond in 14CF278 shall be applied to fine and costs. 2) Undergo and complete AODA and any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent, and abide by all treatment recommendations, to include a driver's safety plan. 3)  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this state unless authorized by the Motor Vehicle Department 4) Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol or detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood. 5) Defendant to serve 100 days in jail with huber privileges and good time, to begin forthwith. 6) Driver's license revocation for a period of 36 months 7) Ignition interlock for a period of 36 months.
Appeal rights were provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-26-2015 01:45 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-08-2015 10:15 am
